data.name: number of duplicate feature instances
data.definition: total number of exact duplications of feature instances within the data
data.example:
Features with identical attribution and identical coordinates representing the same real object, for example: two (or more) points collected on top of each other
D13288RZ.EPS two (or more) curves collected on top of each other
D13288SZ.EPS two (or more) surfaces collected on top of each other.

data.name: number of invalid overlaps of surfaces
data.definition: total number of erroneous overlaps within the data
data.description: Which surfaces may overlap and which shall not is application dependent. Not all overlapping surfaces are necessarily erroneous. When reporting this data quality measure, the types of feature classes corresponding to the illegal overlapping surfaces shall be reported as well. See also: https://standards.isotc211.org/19157/-1/1/dqc/content/qualityMeasure/204
data.example:
Search for surfaces that are not allowed to overlap according to the conceptual schema. In this case, forest and built-up-area are not allowed to overlap
D13288XZ.EPS

data.name: non-compliance rate with respect to the rules of the conceptual schema
data.definition: number of items in the dataset that are not compliant with the rules of the conceptual schema in relation to the total number of these items supposed to be in the dataset
data.description: The value indicates number of items in the dataset that are not compliant with the rules of the conceptual schema in relation to the total number of these items supposed to be in the dataset
data.example: 0,02 (in a test area there is 227 objects coded as living houses in the dataset but in the universe of discourse there are 231 objects that should be coded as living houses, 4 of them was coded as farm buildings)

data.name: value domain non-conformance
data.definition: indication of if an item is not in conformance with its value domain
data.description: The value true indicates that an item is not in conformance with its value domain)
data.example: True – a feature with attribute colour has the value ‘blau’, but it does not exist in the specified value domain: red, green, blue, yellow

data.name: physical structure conflicts
data.definition: indication that items are stored in conflict with the physical structure of the dataset
data.description: The value true indicates physical structure conflict
data.example: True (the dataset is stored in wrong file format, a shape file instead of gml)

data.name: number of faulty point-curve connections
data.definition: number of faulty point-curve connections in the dataset
data.description: A point-curve connection exists where different curves touch. These curves have an intrinsic topological relationship that shall reflect the true constellation. If the point-curve connection contradicts the universe of discourse, the point-curve connection is faulty with respect to this data quality measure. The data quality measure counts the number of errors of this kind.
data.example: Count the number of wrong curve connections - e.g. two-point curve connections exist where only one should be present, or count all curves with more than the threshold value of 500 vertices (in which system automatically places point-curve based on vertices limitation built into software code where no spatial justification for point-curve exists).

data.name: root mean square error of planimetry
data.definition: radius of a circle around the given point, in which the true value lies with probability P
data.description: The true values of the observed coordinates X and Y are known as xt and yt. From this the estimator

data.name: time accuracy at 99,8 % significance level
data.basicMeasure: LE99.8 or LE99.8(r), depending on the evaluation procedure
data.definition: half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 99,8 %
data.description: The value indicates the probability for the true value of being within a lower and the upper limit of the interval.

data.name: misclassification matrix
data.definition: matrix that indicates the number of items of class (i) classified as class (j)

data.name: data product specification passed
data.definition: indication that all requirements in the referred data product specification are fulfilled
data.description: The measure will take the  value true if all the requirements in the referred data product specification are fulfilled

data.name: data product specification fail count
data.definition: number of data product specification requirements that are not fulfilled by the current product/dataset

data.name: mean value of positional uncertainties (1D, 2D and 3D)
absolute circular error at 90 % significance level of biased data
data.definition: absolute horizontal accuracy of the data’s coordinates, expressed in terms of circular error at 90 % probability given that a bias is present
